meanings.definition: To defeat an opponent in boxing by using quick footwork and long-range punches.
meanings.sent1: During the match, he was outboxing his opponent with his fast movements.
meanings.sent2: She practiced outboxing techniques to improve her chances of winning.
meanings.sent3: The boxer's outboxing skills were so good, his opponent couldn't keep up!
meanings.sent4: He outboxed his rival with such precision that it seemed like a dance.
meanings.sent5: Outboxing requires agility and strategy to outsmart the other boxer.

meanings.definition: The act of outmaneuvering an opponent in a boxing match.
meanings.sent1: His outboxing of the opponent was impressive to watch.
meanings.sent2: The key to winning was his outboxing throughout the match.
meanings.sent3: The outboxing in the ring was like a chess game with punches.
meanings.sent4: Her outboxing was so smooth, it seemed like she could predict every move.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered at the outboxing display of skill and strategy.

meanings.definition: A boxing strategy that focuses on maintaining distance and using jabs to control the pace of the fight.
meanings.sent1: His outboxing style kept his opponent at bay throughout the match.
meanings.sent2: The outboxing technique proved effective in controlling the fight.
meanings.sent3: The outboxing approach was like fencing with gloves instead of swords.
meanings.sent4: She mastered the outboxing strategy, making her a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: Outboxing is all about precision and timing to stay ahead in the match.
